attributes.action: help Law Students qualify and not make them destined for debt and financial ruin as newly practicing Solicitors and Barristers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Legal Practice Course Students from accross the Country have to pay tuition fees well in excess of £8,500 for one year's study.

They are currently forced to fund the course from a commercial bank loan or private funding.  This is an unacceptable situation and one in which the future lawyers and members of the United Kingdom's judiciary are starting their professional life deep in debt with when adding accomodation and living costs total soaring to £18,000 all for their one year of study at the LPC Providers.

We LPC Students feel that we should be granted all our tuition fees for free by the British Government as our future of law is jepardised by the current farce that restricts so many students who have graduated with Law degrees from completing their legal training
